White Chocolate Key Lime Muffins or Cake Recipe

By Peggy Trowbridge Filippone

Updated 04/05/19

  • Total: 35 mins
  • Prep: 10 mins
  • Cook: 25 mins
  • Yield: 18 muffins/18 servings
7 ratings
Add a comment
Nutritional Guidelines (per serving)
154 Calories
6g Fat
23g Carbs
3g Protein
See Full Nutritional Guidelines Hide Full Nutritional Guidelines
×
Nutrition Facts
Servings: 18 muffins/18 servings
Amount per serving
Calories 154
% Daily Value*
Total Fat 6g 8%
Saturated Fat 3g 16%
Cholesterol 61mg 20%
Sodium 162mg 7%
Total Carbohydrate 23g 8%
Dietary Fiber 1g 3%
Protein 3g
Calcium 64mg 5%
*The % Daily Value (DV) tells you how much a nutrient in a food serving contributes to a daily diet. 2,000 calories a day is used for general nutrition advice.
(Nutrition information is calculated using an ingredient database and should be considered an estimate.)

The combination of key limes and white chocolate is irresistable. Use this basic recipe for incredibly moist and delightfully tangy sweet or .

Ingredients

  • Cupcakes or Cake:
  • 1-3/4 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2 teaspoons
  • baking powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 6 tablespoons butter (softened)
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 2 large eggs (lightly beaten)
  • 1-1/2 teaspoonsÂ key lime zest (grated)
  • 1 tablespoon fresh
  • key lime juice
  • 2/3 cup
  • buttermilk
  • Glaze:
  • 1 cup powdered sugar
  • 1/8 cup fresh key lime juice

Steps to Make It

For Muffins:

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line standard-size muffin tin with foil liners.

  2. Blend the flour, baking powder, and salt together in a small bowl. Set aside.

  3. In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar together with a mixer, beating until blended.

  4. Add the eggs, 1-1/2 teaspoons lime zest, and 1 tablespoon lime juice.

  5. Into the butter-cream mixture in the large bowl, add 1/3 of the flour mixture, stirring until combined.

  6. Add one-third of the buttermilk, stirring until combined.

  7. Continue alternating one-third of each until all is mixed well. Fold in white chocolate chips.

  8. Fill cupcake liners two-thirds full with batter.

  9. Bake 18 to 20 minutes (or 12 to 14 minutes for mini-muffins) until wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean.

    Glaze:

  10. Whisk powdered sugar and 1/8 cup lime juice together until combined and smooth.

  11. While muffins are still warm, poke holes in the tops of the muffins with a wooden pick.

  12. Smooth about a teaspoon on top of each warm muffin.

  13. Cool completely.

    For Cake:

  14. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare 9 x 13-inch baking pan by lining with foil (non-stick foil recommended).

  15. Follow the same mixing instructions as above.

  16. Spread batter evenly in pan.

  17. Bake 35 to 40 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.

  18. Let rest in pan about 5 minutes and then poke holes all over the top of the cake with a wooden pick.

  19. Spread glaze evenly over top of cake and cool completely.

  20. Cut into pieces to serve.

Recipe Tags:

  • chocolate
  • breakfast
  • u.s. regional
  • fall
